item.title: Mother, nine-month-old son found dead in Bagerhat
item.description: Police recovered the bodies of a woman and her nine-month-old son in Bagerhat in Bagerhat. The dead were identified as 22-year-old Subarna Swarnali and her son, identified by the single name Nazif, reports bdnews24.com. Subarna’s husband, Jewel Hasan Saddam, is the president of the banned C

item.title: Rajshahi Warriors clinch BPL title
item.description: Rajshahi Warriors clinched the Bangladesh Premier League (BPL) title, beating Chattogram Royals by 63 runs, in the final match of the tournament on Friday. The final was played at Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium in Mirpur, with Chattogram opting to field first after winning the toss in the

item.title: Tarique hears voters’ pleas at first Dhaka rally
item.description: BNP Chairperson Tarique Rahman has listened directly to voters’ problems and expectations after calling residents onto the stage at the first election rally in his Dhaka constituency, pledging to address their concerns if elected. He attended the public meeting on Friday in Bhashantek of Dha

item.title: EU to suspend €93bn retaliatory trade package against US for 6 months
item.description: The European Commission said on Friday it would propose suspending for another six months an EU package of retaliatory trade measures against the US worth 93 billion euros ($109.19 billion) that would otherwise kick in on Feb 7. The package, prepared in the first half of last year when the Europea

item.title: People will vote to reject corrupt candidates: Hasnat Abdullah
item.description: Hasnat Abdullah, the 10-party alliance candidate for Cumilla-4 (Debidwar) and chief organiser (south) of the National Citizen Party (NCP), on Friday said the people would reject corrupt candidates through the ballot. Speaking at several street rallies during door-to-door campaigning on the second

item.title: Global fertility divide
item.description: The world is entering a period of demographic divide that few policymakers are prepared to confront openly. item.title: Importance of training for banks
item.description: Every year, National Training Day in Bangladesh is observed on January 23. This year, Bangladesh observed the 30th anniversary to emphasise the importance of training for human resource development, skill enhancement, and economic growth. item.title: Can election ensure a smooth political transition?
item.description: With the national election set to take place within three weeks, political parties have started their campaigns. The campaign will intensify as election will be closer. item.title: Dollar dependence vs economic power politics
item.description: The global economy is entering another uncertain chapter as many long-held assumptions about trade and growth lose their footing. item.title: Govt employees' pay hike and economic challenges
item.description: The Ninth National Pay Commission report, as submitted on Wednesday (January 21), is learnt to have recommended a sweeping hike in the basic salaries of government servants. Evidently, implementation of this new pay structure is going to cost the state exchequer a humongous sum of additional Tk 1.0

item.title: Fakhrul warns Jamaat-e-Islami poses ‘threat’ to Bangladesh
item.description: BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir has described Jamaat-e-Islami, a force that opposed the 1971 Liberation War, as a threat to the nation's safety. He believes that the country cannot be secure in the hands of those who originally did not want the birth of Bangladesh. Speaking at a

item.title: Jamaat alleges election code violations in eight districts
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami has alleged that the electoral code of conduct has been violated in eight districts during election campaigning.
